Package com.intellij.util.text

Class TextRangeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.util.text.TextRangeUtil

  • public class TextRangeUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Miscellaneous utility methods to manipulate lists of text ranges.
    See Also:
    TextRange

      • RANGE_COMPARATOR

        public static final java.util.Comparator<TextRange> RANGE_COMPARATOR

    • Method Detail

      • excludeRanges

        public static java.lang.Iterable<TextRange> excludeRanges(TextRange original,
                                                          java.util.List<? extends TextRange> excludedRanges)
        Excludes ranges from the original range. For example, if the original range is [30..100] and ranges to exclude are [20..50] and [60..90], resulting ranges will be [50..60] and [90..100]. The ranges may overlap and follow in any order. In the latter case the original list of excluded ranges is sorted by start/end offset.
        Parameters:
        original - The original range to exclude the ranges from.
        excludedRanges - The list of ranges to exclude.
        Returns:
        A list of ranges after excluded ranges have been applied.

      • getEnclosingTextRange

        public static TextRange getEnclosingTextRange(java.util.List<? extends TextRange> textRanges)
        Return least text range that contains all of passed text ranges. For example for {[0, 3],[3, 7],[10, 17]} this method will return [0, 17]
        Parameters:
        textRanges - The list of ranges to process
        Returns:
        least text range that contains all of passed text ranges

      • intersectsOneOf

        public static boolean intersectsOneOf(TextRange range,
                                      java.util.List<? extends TextRange> rangeList)
        Checks that the given range intersects one of the ranges in the list by performing a binary search.
        Parameters:
        range - The range to check.
        rangeList - The range list. The list must be ordered by range start offset.
        Returns:
        True if the range intersects at least one range in the list.

      • rangesContain

        public static boolean rangesContain(java.util.List<? extends TextRange> rangeList,
                                    int offset)
        Checks that the given offset is contained in one of the ranges in the list by performing a binary search.
        Parameters:
        range - The range to check.
        rangeList - The range list. The list must be ordered by range start offset.
        Returns:
        True if the range intersects at least one range in the list.

      • getDistance

        public static int getDistance(Segment r2,
                              Segment r1)
